item.title: How to Communicate Without the Internet: LoRa, Mesh, and Magic
item.description: The Internet is a house of cards. LoRa, mesh networks, and a bit of radio magic can keep us talking when the lights go out.

item.title: Open-Source Localism in Kirksville
item.description: Kirksville’s open-source advantage — rebuild, repair, and reuse instead of rent and replace.

item.title: The Kirksville Local’s Guide to Free and Open-Source Software
item.description: A simple guide from Kirksville’s local tech shop on free and open-source software that saves money, increases privacy, and puts you back in control of your computer.

item.title: Why I Link to Wayback Machine Instead of Original Sites
item.description: Back in 2020 I warned that the live web couldn’t be trusted to stay stable. Today, it’s worse than ever.

item.title: Why You Should Use ProtonMail in Kirksville: The Email That Doesnt Spy on You
item.description: Google reads your emails like a nosy neighbor. ProtonMail locks them up tighter than Fort Knox. Heres why that matters in Kirksville.
